entries.title: Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX execs received billions in hidden loans, ex-Alameda CEO says
entries.description: Sam Bankman-Fried and other FTX executives received billions of dollars in secret loans from the crypto mogul’s Alameda Research, the hedge fund’s former chief told a judge when she pleaded guilty to her role in the exchange’s collapse.

entries.title: Facebook parent Meta agrees to pay $725 million to settle Cambridge Analytica suit
entries.description: Meta has agreed to pay $725 million to settle a class action lawsuit that claimed Facebook gave third parties access to user data without their consent.

entries.title: 'It’s corn!,' 'Dark Brandon' and 'girl explaining': A look at the most notable memes of 2022
entries.description: Memes, for better or for worse, were there for all the highs and lows of 2022. Here are the most noteworthy ones of 2022.

entries.title: Silicon Valley is coming for your gut biome
entries.description: Cryptocurrency hasn’t worked out so well for tech investors. Neither has the metaverse so far.

entries.title: New AI technology ChatGPT raising questions about human creativity
entries.description: ChatGPT is a new artificial intelligence technology that can write term papers, software and legal documents all in a matter of seconds, but it’s raising alarms about the value of human creativity. NBC News’ Jacob Ward explains why some are predicting the program could wipe out whole industries.
